attributes.action: Reinstate Boris Johnson as the British Prime Minister.
attributes.additional_details: Reinstate Boris Johnson as Prime minister as mandated by the electorate.
attributes.background: Boris Johnson was elected with a huge majority. Many voters who had never voted conservative previously  voted for the policies and manifesto promoted by Mr Johnson. He still has a mandate from the British people and had delivered on much of the policy before the media and libertarian coup.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions about appointments, which includes calling for Ministers to be sacked or replaced.

In any case, decisions about changes to the leaders of political parties are a matter for individual political parties, not the UK Government or Parliament.
